definitions.text: someone who gives a warning so that a mistake can be avoided
an ironclad vessel built by Federal forces to do battle with the Merrimac
display produced by a device that takes signals and displays them on a television screen or a computer monitor
electronic equipment that is used to check the quality or content of electronic transmissions
a piece of electronic equipment that keeps track of the operation of a system continuously and warns of trouble
any of various large tropical carnivorous lizards of Africa and Asia and Australia; fabled to warn of crocodiles
keep tabs on; keep an eye on; keep under surveillance
examples: we are monitoring the air quality
the police monitor the suspect's moves

definitions.text: check, track, or observe by means of a receiver
